shared_text:
Imagine Schools
September 7 at 5:01 AM ·

Happy Labor Day! 💕

Labor Day is a result of the labor movement and was created to celebrate the social and economic achievements of American workers. Each year on this day we honor contributions workers have made to the strength, prosperity, and well-being of our country.

Today, we wanted to take some time to especially thank those essential workers who have worked so diligently for the rest of us during quarantine.

#ThankYouEssentialWorkers #LaborDay2020

post_text: On July 23, 2020, Governor Ducey announced a new Executive Order, Open for Learning, directing all Arizona schools to use health metrics as to when schools may open for in-person learning. These metrics will be included in a framework developed by the Arizona Department of Public Health and Arizona Department of Education. We anticipate receiving the framework by August 7th. At this time, Imagine Schools is reviewing all components of the new Executive Order and will share an update with staff and families very soon. Remote learning for all Imagine students begins on August 5th as originally scheduled. The health and safety of our students and staff, as well as the academic growth and character development of each student, remain as our top priorities. Thank you for your continued support!
text: On July 23, 2020, Governor Ducey announced a new Executive Order, Open for Learning, directing all Arizona schools to use health metrics as to when schools may open for in-person learning. These metrics will be included in a framework developed by the Arizona Department of Public Health and Arizona Department of Education. We anticipate receiving the framework by August 7th. At this time, Imagine Schools is reviewing all components of the new Executive Order and will share an update with staff and families very soon. Remote learning for all Imagine students begins on August 5th as originally scheduled. The health and safety of our students and staff, as well as the academic growth and character development of each student, remain as our top priorities. Thank you for your continued support!

shared_text:
Imagine Schools
May 22 at 5:01 AM ·

We are proud and humbled to announce that Imagine Schools has been named as a 2020 National District of Character. Imagine Schools is the only charter network in the nation to receive this award

Additionally, four individual Imagine campuses were recognized as National Schools of Character:

☀ Imagine Bell Canyon, Arizona
☀ Imagine Coolidge Elementary, Arizona
☀ Imagine Kissimmee Charter Academy, Florida
☀ Imagine Schools at South Lake, Florida (recertified for the 4th time)

“Each of these schools and school districts has put in place a comprehensive approach to help their students understand, care about, and consistently practice the core values that will enable them to flourish in school, in relationships, in the workplace, and as citizens,” said Dr. Arthur Schwartz, President of Character.org.

Congratulations, Imagine. Thank you for continuing to show your character and prove that we are #CharterStrong. #WeAreImagine

Click the link to read more about this honorable recognition.

https://www.imagineschools.org/2020/05/imagine-schools-wins-national-award-for-character-education-2/

post_text: We are proud to announce that Imagine Bell Canyon was just awarded its ninth Promising Practices Award from Character.org! This award recognizes our "Upstanders Stations" event; a school wide event that engaged students and staff in activities to help recognize, prevent and respond to bullying. Congratulations to Imagine Bell Canyon's teachers, students and staff!

post_text: We want to remind you that Imagine Schools will be providing ‘Grab and Go’ drive thru meal service for any child/student 18 years old and younger . Each bag/box will include a FREE Breakfast and Lunch Meal. All meals meet the requirements of the NSLP/USDA School Nutrition Programs. Meals may be picked up 9:00 am to 12:30 pm, Monday thru Friday

post_text: Although schools are closed, Imagine Schools is committed to serving its students, families, and communities! Meals on Wheels continues (see video), and we are serving grab n' go meals at the school (18052 N. Black Canyon Hwy., Phoenix, AZ 85053) from 9am to 12:30pm daily Monday through Friday.

Although schools are closed, Imagine Schools is committed to serving its students, families, and communities! Meals on Wheels continues (see video), and we are serving grab n' go meals at the school (18052 N. Black Canyon Hwy., Phoenix, AZ 85053) from 9am to 12:30pm daily Monday through Friday.

post_text:
Please like & SHARE!

Child Care @ IBC starting tomorrow!!!

In an effort to show appreciation and support for
families of nurses, doctors, police, firefighters and others the community relies on, Imagine Schools is announcing a unique partnership with Champions, part of the KinderCare Education LLC. Working together, we are providing full day child care for children ages 3-12 of first responders and front line health care workers responding to the COVID19 situation.

See flyer for details...

post_text:
IBC is providing FREE Meals!
Please review the list of Imagine school locations providing FREE Breakfast and Lunch for pick up starting March 17, 2020 until further notice. All students, 18 years and younger are welcome to partake in this program. These meals are provided through the federal National Student Lunch Program (NSLP) at no cost to you. Each bag/box will include one breakfast and one lunch meal per student. The student or child must be present to receive the meals. The meals may be picked up Monday – Friday between 9:00 am and 12:30 pm. Staff will be present to hand you the bagged meals. You do not have to exit your car.

post_text:
All AZ Imagine Schools are closed for students effective Monday, March 16. This closure will be in effect at least until March 27, 2020. The front office at each school will be open only on Monday, March 16 from 8AM-12 noon for families to pick up any essential student items, like medication.

Please check your school’s website and social media for the most up to date information in the days to come.

Please check your school’s website and social media for the most up to date information in the days to come.

post_text:
We received our AdvancED accreditation certificate in the mail today!

Imagine Bell Canyon is proudly accredited by NCA CASI, NWAC, and SACS CASI, accrediting divisions of AdvancED. Our accreditation demonstrates our dedication to continuous improvement in all we do. We are committed to providing a student-centered experience through which BlazerWorld citizens (our students) are challenged to develop the knowledge, skills, and character to positively and productively contribute in a global society.

post_text:
Welcome, Ms. Kramer - Middle School English Language Arts & Social Studies Teacher

Lindsey Kramer is originally from West Des Moines, Iowa. She received her bachelor’s degree in international studies from Covenant College, and her master’s degree in curriculum and instruction from the University of San Diego. Ms. Kramer started becoming interested in teaching while working as an Arabic tutor in college. She completed her student teaching in a 6-8 English Language Development classroom, and she is excited for her first year of full-time teaching. Ms. Kramer says Alexander Solzhenitsyn is someone who inspires her. He was a writer and social commentator who brought global awareness to some of the crimes of the USSR. Ms. Kramer likes to crochet, go hiking, and read books! The Lord of the Rings series are her favorite books. She also loves seeing her students become better readers and writers. Her parents live in Payson, AZ with their family dog, Mindy, and she has one brother who lives in Denver, CO, and is a serious rock climber.

post_text:
Welcome Mrs. Berman - Kindergarten Teacher!

Emily Berman is originally from St. Louis, Missouri. She received a bachelor’s degree in liberal studies from Arizona State University, and a master’s degree in early childhood education from Grand Canyon University. Mrs. Berman is excited for her first year of teaching. She also has experience as a paraprofessional in preschool and the K-6 setting. Mrs. Berman says her mom is her hero, because she taught her everything she knows about being strong and independent. Mrs. Berman loves to read, run, and play with her two dogs. She also loves that she gets to come to work every day knowing that she is making a difference in someone else’s life no matter how big or small that impact may be. Mrs. Berman’s family includes her husband, Andrew, and their two dogs, Jet and Junior. Her mom, dad, and sister also live in Phoenix. Mrs. Berman is so excited to get this year started!
